Dear Mrs. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI670290161
Licensee Group Organization: Eagle Village Inc
Licensee Designee: Cathey Prudhomme
Chief Administrator: Cathey Prudhomme
Agency Name: Eagle Village - Hainley House
Agency Address: 17106 W VILLAGE RD
HERSEY, MI 49639-9757
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 02/29/2024
Capacity: 10
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
4/17/2023 Email Special Investigation Initiation
4/18/2023 Documentation Documentation received or sent
4/18/2023 Phone Other
4/18/2023 Documentation Other

4/19/2023 Face to Face Interview
4/19/2023 Email Other

4/20/2023 Phone Interview

4/21/2023 Email Pre-Exit Conference
5/12/2023 Video Conference Dispositional Conference -No
findings
III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was sexually assaulted by two different youth at CCI on
multiple occasions. This was reported to staff.
Investigation Interviews
Therapist Z/Complainant was interviewed via TEAMS on April
20, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Therapist Z
said she never had previous information that Youth A was
sexually abused or involved in any inappropriate sexual acts with
any of the youth at Hainley. Therapist Z said she was the on-call
therapist the weekend of April 15, 2023. Therapist Z said she had
received a call regarding an incident with Youth A at Putnam on
April 14, 2023 which resulted in Youth A being placed on a safety
plan. Therapist Z said on April 15, 2023, she followed up with
Youth A to process what had occurred the night prior. Therapist Z
said while talking with Youth A he disclosed that he had been
sexually assaulted while placed at Hainley. Therapist Z said Youth
A told her during his first week at Hainley he was walking by the
bathroom when Youth C grabbed him by the shirt and pulled him
into the bathroom and sexually assaulted him. Therapist Z said
Youth A told her this same assault had occurred on three separate
occasions throughout his stay at Hainley and on the third occasion
Youth C covered Youth A’s mouth so he could not breathe.
Therapist Z said Youth A also disclosed being sexually assaulted
by Youth B while at Hainley, stating he was in the back room and
Youth B forced Youth A to sit in one of the living room chairs and
was assaulted. Therapist Z said Youth A said Youth B assaulted
him a second time in the front of Hainley by “slamming him
against the window” and having sex with him. Therapist Z said
Youth A told her he reported these incidents to Staff 3 and Staff 4
however they did not do anything about it.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
18, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth A
reported he is placed at Putnam however previously was placed at
Hainley. Youth A said he had many issues with the youth while at
Hainley. Youth A said his peers would “dump water” on him to
wake him up in the morning when the female staff were working,
and they allowed it. Youth A said he was sexually abused by
2

Youth B and Youth C while residing at Hainley. Youth A said
Youth B “grabbed him” when he was walking from the back living
area to the dining room and covered his mouth “with both hands”
and “put his privates in my butt and front”. Youth A said this
occurred by the stove in the kitchen and the staff and other youth
were in the back living room watching television. Youth A said the
second time Youth B sexually assaulted him he was in the
sensory room and Youth B entered and covered his mouth and
pulled down Youth A’s pants and touched his penis and butt.
Youth A then changed and said Youth B “tried” to touch him but
he hit and kicked him repeatedly, so he was not able to touch him.
Youth A said he told Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 4, and Staff 5 about this
situation and at first he said “staff did nothing” but then said Staff 1
“grounded” Youth B for two months making Youth B “sit at the
table all day long for two months”. Youth A denied that he ever
attempted to or touched Youth B sexually. Youth A said Youth C
sexually assaulted him once. Youth A said he was walking by the
bathroom and Youth C “grabbed my shirt and pulled me in the
bathroom”. Youth A said Youth C told him to “have sex”, kicked
him, and then covered his mouth with both hands so he passed
out. Youth A said five minutes later he “woke up” and kicked
Youth C and left the bathroom. Youth A said he told Staff 2 right
away but “nothing happened”. Youth A said he later told Therapist
Y during a therapy session but “nothing happened”. Youth A said
Supervisor told him that they “reviewed video” but still “nothing
happened”. Youth A said a staff, he was unable to remember who,
told him they were not going to write any reports about these
incidents. Youth A denied that he ever attempted to or touched
Youth C sexually. Youth A originally stated that he called Foster
Care Worker after each incident, later stating he only told Foster
Care Worker once about the sexual abuse.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
18, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B
said he was previously placed at Hainley with Youth A. Youth B
said he had many “problems” with Youth A while at Hainley
however could not remember what they were. Youth B said he
was playing with his toys in the back living room one day while all
other youth and staff were outside when Youth A came inside and
began “moaning” and then “touched his dick”. Youth B said this
occurred over his clothing and only happened one time. Youth B
said he slapped Youth A for touching him. Youth B said he told
staff however was not able to recall which staff member but stated
the staff “did nothing about it”, later stating he also told Therapist
Y about the incident. Youth B said he is not aware of Youth A
being sexually inappropriate with any other youth.
3

Youth C was interviewed via telephone on April 21, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth C said he was
placed at Hainley with “four or five other kids” but was unable to
remember the names of any of the youth. Youth C stated he did
not remember Youth A or Youth B. Youth C said he was never in
the bathroom with any other youth. Youth C said he was never left
alone in the house without staff. Youth C said no other youth ever
tried to touch him sexually and he denied touching any other youth
sexually. Youth C said he was the oldest in the house at the time
and “kept to himself”.
Therapist Y was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 19, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Therapist Y said she was the therapist for Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C while they were placed at Hainley. Therapist Y said Youth
A never disclosed any sexual abuse from Youth B or Youth C
during his conversations with her. Therapist Y said neither Youth
B or Youth C ever disclosed any sexual behaviors with Youth A to
her during any of their conversations. Therapist Y said she did not
have any concerns about Youth A, Youth B, or Youth C having
inappropriate sexual behaviors with one another. Therapist Y said
Youth A did have sexual abuse in his history and would have a
very hard time processing this information in treatment. Therapist
Y said Youth A would make sexual gestures and “moaning noises”
at times which he was redirected for, however these behaviors
were normally at times that he wanted to divert staff’s attention
from something else he did not want to do or talk about. Therapist
Y said she has no knowledge of anyone watching video regarding
concerns about sexual behaviors between Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C. Therapist Y said none of the staff have ever brought
concerns about sexual behaviors between Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C to her or during team meetings.
Therapist X was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 18, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Therapist X said she is currently the therapist for Youth B.
Therapist X said Youth B has never disclosed any sexual abuse
while he was placed at Hainley. Therapist X said Youth B has
never disclosed anything to her at all about Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 18, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Supervisor said they were the supervisor during Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C’s placement at Hainley. Supervisor said Youth A
never disclosed any sexual assaults to him. Supervisor said he
4

never had concerns regarding inappropriate sexual touching
between Youth A, Youth B, or Youth C. Supervisor stated Youth A
and Youth B did not get along and would have verbal and physical
altercations however never were they sexual in nature. Supervisor
said youth are never to be left alone or unsupervised in the house
or outside. Supervisor said he is not aware of any incidents when
Youth A or Youth B were alone in the house or unsupervised
together at any point in time during their stay at Hainley.
Supervisor denied ever looking up video footage regarding sexual
assault concerns or telling Youth A he ever looked at video
footage about anything. Supervisor said none of the staff ever
reported to him that they had concerns or knowledge of sexual
assaults occurring at Hainley with Youth A, Youth B, or Youth C.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 19,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said he
worked at Hainley with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Staff 1
said Youth A never told him he was sexually abused by Youth B
or Youth C. Staff 1 said Youth A and Youth B would argue and
physically fight however there was never any concerns about
sexual behaviors. Staff 1 said he never had any concerns about
Youth A and Youth C’s interactions. Staff 1 said none of the youth
are ever left alone inside or unsupervised when they are with each
other. Staff 1 said no one has ever told him about any
inappropriate sexual touching concerns with Youth A, Youth B, or
Youth C. Staff 1 said he never reviewed any video footage or told
Youth A that he did review video footage. Staff 1 said Youth A
would sometimes mimic other youth’s behaviors in the house and
had to be redirected for making a “moaning noise” in front of the
other youth but otherwise there was no concern about any kind of
sexual acting out with Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 19,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said he
worked with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C when they were
placed at Hainley. Staff 2 said Youth A never told him he was
sexually assaulted by Youth B or Youth C. Staff 2 said Youth B
and Youth C never disclosed any sexual abuse to him. Staff 2 said
he had no concerns about inappropriate sexual behaviors
between Youth A, Youth B, or Youth C. Staff 2 denied ever giving
Youth B two months of consequences or seeing him sitting at the
table for two months.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 19,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said he
worked with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C while they were
5

placed at Hainley. Staff 3 said Youth A would make inappropriate
sexual comments and make “moaning noises” but he never
disclosed any sexual abuse from his past or with Youth B or Youth
C to him. Staff 3 said Youth A and Youth B “never got along” and
would argue and physically fight at times. Staff 3 said Youth C
never had anything to do with Youth A or Youth B.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 19,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 4 said he
worked with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C when they were
placed at Hainley. Staff 4 said Youth A never disclosed being
sexually assaulted by Youth B or Youth C to him. Staff 4 said he
had no knowledge or concern about inappropriate sexual
behaviors between Youth A, Youth B or Youth C. Staff 4 said
youth are never allowed to be alone together or alone in the house
and he has never heard of this occurring. Staff 4 said he has no
knowledge of anyone reviewing camera footage and denied
looking at any camera footage himself.
Staff 5 was interviewed via TEAMS on April 20, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 5 said she worked
at Hainley when Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C were placed
there. Staff 5 said Youth A never told her he was sexually abused
by Youth B or Youth C. Staff 5 said neither Youth B or Youth C
ever discussed sexually abusing anyone or being sexually abused
by anyone with her. Staff 5 said Youth B did not sit at a table for
two months nor was he grounded or on any consequence that
long. Staff 5 said the youth are never allowed to be alone in the
house and she has no knowledge of that occurring with Youth B or
any of the other youth. Staff 5 denied watching video footage at
any point in time regarding Youth A. Staff 5 said she never caught
youth in the bathroom together with the doors closed. Staff 5 said
she had no concerns about inappropriate sexual boundaries being
crossed by Youth A, Youth B or Youth C. Staff 5 said Youth A and
Youth B would argue and physically attempt to hurt one another
but it was never sexual in nature.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on April
20, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Foster Care
Worker said she was assigned to Youth A’s case when he was
placed at Hainley. Foster Care Worker denied Youth A ever telling
her he was sexually abused while he was actively placed at
Hainley. Foster Care Worker said she visited Youth A on April 17,
2023, in his new placement and that is when he disclosed being
sexually abused by Youth B and Youth C. Foster Care Worker
6

said Youth A did not provide detail in his disclosure as he was
more focused on getting off grounding at his current placement.
Vice President of Programs was interviewed face-to-face on
April 18, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Vice
President of Programs searched the internal incident reports for
any sexual behaviors reported for Youth A, Youth B or Youth C
and there were no results. Vice President of Programs said she
was never made aware prior to now of any concerning sexualize
behaviors with Youth A and any other youth.
Documents Reviewed
• Supervisor Personnel File: There was one disciplinary
action dated October 2, 2020, for failure to use agency time
clock. Supervisor completed Incident Reporting on January
30, 2022, and Policy/Procedure training on March 2, 2022.
• Staff 1’s Personnel File: There was no disciplinary record.
Staff 1 completed Incident Reporting on March 15, 2022,
and February 22, 2023. Staff 1 completed
Policy/Procedures training on March 18, 2022, March 15,
2022, March 21, 2022, and March 22, 2022.
• Staff 2’s Personnel File: There was no disciplinary record.
Staff 2 completed Incident Reporting training on March 15,
2022. Staff 2 completed Policy/Procedure training on March
8, 2022, March 15, 2022, March 21, 2022, and March 22,
2022.
• Staff 3’s Personnel File: There was one disciplinary action
dated January 25, 2023, for absenteeism. Staff 3
completed Incident Reporting training on June 10, 2022.
Staff 3 completed Policy/Procedure training on June 7,
2022, and June 8, 2022.
• Staff 4’s Personnel File: There was no disciplinary record.
Staff 4 completed Incident Reporting training on September
29, 2022. Staff 4 completed Policy/Procedure training on
September 20, 2022, September 21, 2022, and September
29, 2022.
• Staff 5’s Personnel File: There was no disciplinary record.
Staff 5 completed Incident Reporting training on September
29, 2022. Staff 5 completed Policy/Procedure training on
September 20, 2022, September 21, 2022, and September
22, 2022.
• Eagle Village Supervision of Residents Policy and
Procedure which outlines the expectations of staff to
supervise youth and to ensure checks are completed when
youth are showering or using the bathroom.
7

Tour Observation
A tour of Hainley occurred on April 19, 2023. There are two
bathrooms for the youth, and both are off the main living area in
the back of the house. The bathrooms are for individual use and
have doors that close and lock.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Program Statement. Youth
A disclosed abuse from Youth B and Youth C however his
statement was inconsistent throughout the interview as well as
different from what he told his current staff at Putnam and
Therapist Z. Youth B disclosed Youth A “grabbed” his penis
however Youth A denied this, and all staff consistently report
Youth B was never left alone or unsupervised in the house. None
of the staff interviewed had any knowledge of the alleged abuse
all consistently stating Youth A never reported any of these
concerns while at Hainley. Therefore, there is no evidence to
support the staff did not supervise the youth appropriately.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
_____________________________________May 12, 2023
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg Date
Licensing Consultant

8
